description.narrative: The areas of intervention in Sphere 2 are linked to three (out of four) DGF II high-level outcomes as follows: • To strengthen democratic processes that respond to citizens’ rights • To increase protection and fulfilment of human rights and gender equality • To improve citizens’ inclusion and engagement in decision-making processes This sphere is distinct in nature from sphere 1 and 3, as its starting point is the citizens, the rights holders, and the strengthening of civil society. Sphere 2 directly connects to Sphere 1 in terms of how civil society can contribute to enhancing government accountability, and it also relates directly to Sphere 3, whose themes are all relevant for Sphere 2 (in particular human rights and gender). Sphere 2 is articulated around a Human Rights Based Approach (HRBA); specifically the need to strengthen the capacity of rights holders to hold duty bearers to account in terms of, for example, planning and budgeting, as well as other ways in which government performance affects citizens and their rights (corruption, transparency, resource management etc.). While sphere 2 initiatives mainly focus on rights-holders, it also recognises the need for duty-bearers to have the necessary capabilities to perform their duties and obligations. Initiatives under sphere 2 focusing on government accountability will therefore closely liaise and cooperate with Sphere 1, whereas initiatives focusing on human rights, gender empowerment and representation and participation of women will liaise and cooperate with Sphere 3. The HRBA principles of participation, non-discrimination, accountability and transparency are all integrated into Sphere 2.
